full_text: Page 3758 MCC NEW YORK SPECIAL HOUSING UNIT 30 MINUTE CHECK SHEET ZA TIER-J DATE: 08/10/2019 TIME FRAME TIME START TIME END SIGNATURE TIME FRAME TIME START TIME END SIGNATURE TIME FRAME TIME START TIME END SIGNATURE 12:00-12:30 AM 1205 1206 (b)(6); (b)(7)(C) 8:00-8:30 AM 4:00-4:30 PM 12:30- 1:00 AM 1239 1238 8:30- 9:00 AM 4:30-5:00 PM 1:00-1:30 AM 1057 1058 9:00-9:30 AM 5:00 -5:30 PM 1:30-2:00 AM 1325 1316 9:30-10:00 AM 5:30-6:00 PM 2:00-2:30 AM 2105 2106 10:00-10:30 AM 6:00-6:30 PM 2:30-3:00 AM 2301 2340 10:30-11:00 AM 6:30-7:00 PM 3:00-3:30 AM 2305 2306 11:00-11:30 AM 7:00-7:30 PM 3:30-4:00 AM 2339 2340 11:30-12:00 AM 7:30-8:00 PM 4:00-4:30 AM 4112 4113 12:00-12:30 PM 8:00-8:30 PM 4:30-5:00 AM 4330 4337 12:30- 1:00 PM 8:30- 9:00 PM 5:00 -5:30 AM 4504 4505 1:00-1:30 PM 9:00-9:30 PM 5:30-6:00 AM 4539 4538 1:30-2:00 PM 9:30-10:00 PM 6:00-6:30 AM 605 604 2:00-2:30 PM 10:00-10:30 PM 6:30-7:00 AM 2:30-3:00 PM 10:30-11:00 PM 7:00-7:30 AM 3:00-3:30 PM 11:00-11:30 PM 7:30-8:00 AM 3:30-4:00 PM 11:30-12:00 PM MORNING WATCH OPERATIONS LIEUTENANT (b)(6); (b)(7)(C) DAY WATCH OPERATIONS LIEUTENANT EVENING WATCH OPERATIONS LIEUTENANT A staff member must observe all inmates confined in a continuous locked down status, such as administrative detention or disciplinary segregation, at least once in the first 30 minute period of the hour (example, 12:00 a.m. - 12:30 a.m.) followed by another round in the second 30 minutes period of the same hour (example, 12:30 am - 1:00 a.m.), thus ensuring an inmate is observed at least twice per hour. These rounds are to be conducted on an irregular schedule and no more than 40 minutes apart. All observations must be documented. REVIEWED BY MORNING WATCH LIEUTENANT CAPTAIN DOJ-OGR-00027073

text_blocks.content: MCC NEW YORK SPECIAL HOUSING UNIT 30 MINUTE CHECK SHEET ZA TIER-J DATE: 08/10/2019
TIME FRAME TIME START TIME END SIGNATURE TIME FRAME TIME START TIME END SIGNATURE TIME FRAME TIME START TIME END SIGNATURE
MORNING WATCH OPERATIONS LIEUTENANT DAY WATCH OPERATIONS LIEUTENANT EVENING WATCH OPERATIONS LIEUTENANT

A staff member must observe all inmates confined in a continuous locked down status, such as administrative detention or disciplinary segregation, at least once in the first 30 minute period of the hour (example, 12:00 a.m. - 12:30 a.m.) followed by another round in the second 30 minutes period of the same hour (example, 12:30 am - 1:00 a.m.), thus ensuring an inmate is observed at least twice per hour. These rounds are to be conducted on an irregular schedule and no more than 40 minutes apart. All observations must be documented.
REVIEWED BY MORNING WATCH LIEUTENANT CAPTAIN

additional_notes: The document contains handwritten entries in the table and some redacted information.
